1.content: Strive not with a powerful man, lest thou fall into his hands.

2.content: Contend not with a rich man, lest he bring an action against thee.

3.content: For gold and silver hath destroyed many, and hath reached even to the heart of kings, and perverted them.

4.content: Strive not with a man that is full of tongue, and heap not wood upon his fire.

5.content: Communicate not with an ignorant man, lest he speak ill of thy family.

6.content: Despise not a man that turneth away from sin, nor reproach him therewith: remember that we are all worthy of reproof.

7.content: Despise not a man in his old age; for we also shall become old.

8.content: Rejoice not at the death of thy enemy; knowing that we all die, and are not willing that others should rejoice at our death.

9.content: Despise not the discourse of them that are ancient and wise, but acquaint thyself with their proverbs.

10.content: For of them thou shalt learn wisdom, and instruction of understanding, and to serve great men without blame.

11.content: Let not the discourse of the ancients escape thee, for they have learned of their fathers:

12.content: For of them thou shalt learn understanding, and to give an answer in time of need.

13.content: Kindle not the coals of sinners by rebuking them, lest thou be burnt with the flame of the fire of their sins.

14.content: Stand not against the face of an injurious person, lest he sit as a spy to entrap thee in thy words.

15.content: Lend not to a man that is mightier than thyself: and if thou lendest, count it as lost.

16.content: Be not surety above thy power: and if thou be surety, think as if thou wert to pay it.

17.content: Judge not against a judge: for he judgeth according to that which is just.

18.content: Go not on the way with a bold man, lest he burden thee with his evils: for he goeth according to his own will, and thou shalt perish together with his folly.

19.content: Quarrel not with a passionate man, and go not into the desert with a bold man: for blood is as nothing in his sight, and where there is no help he will overthrow thee.

20.content: Advise not with fools, for they cannot love but such things as please them.

21.content: Before a stranger do no matter of counsel: for thou knowest not what he will bring forth.

22.content: Open not thy heart to every man: lest he repay thee with an evil turn, and speak reproachfully to thee.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
